title: The Dow Rose 36 Points Because the Fed Cut Rates but It Didn’t Cut Loose
text: Not So Bad. All three major indexes rebounded by Wednesday’s close after initially diving after the Federal Reserve’s 25-basis-points rate cut. The Fed didn’t loosen monetary policy. The Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 managed to close with some gains, while the Nasdaq Composite finished just below break-even. President Donald Trump criticized the central bank’s move, tweeting that Fed Chair Jerome Powell and the agency had “no ‘guts,’ no sense, no vision.” Saudi Arabia says Iran was “unquestionably” behind the strike on its oil facilities last Saturday and President Trump said he’ll substantially increase...
description: All three major indexes rebounded by Wednesday’s close after initially diving after the Federal Reserve’s 25-basis-points rate cut. The Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 managed to close with some gains, while the Nasdaq Composite finished just below break-even.
